alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 1:53PM AKDT until May 31 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues due to warmer temperatures. * WHERE...Including the following area, Copper River Basin. * WHEN...Until 200 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occurring along portions of Lake Louise Road. The Gulkana River is also near or at bank-full. Expect near bank-full conditions on other area rivers and streams, including the Copper River, due to snowmelt. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 149 PM AKDT, Alaska DOT officials report there is still water across Lake Louise Road at milepost 16.5 and is blocking the road. High water will continue erosion concerns for area streams and rivers including the Copper River. - For Gakona River near Gakona: At 1:00pm the stage was 6.34 feet. Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 6.4 feet is expected around 4:00pm Wednesday. - For Gulkana River at Sourdough: At 1:15pm the stage was 12.62 feet. Flood Stage is 11.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 12.7 feet is expected around 10:00am Wednesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
